#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Vevey
#Text=Vevey is one of the main cities of the Swiss Riviera , in the Lake Geneva Region of Switzerland .
#Text=By train
#Text=Trains between Geneva and Montreux travel along the northern shore of Lake Geneva and stop in Vevey .
#Text=From elsewhere in Switzerland , you need to change in Lausanne .
#Text=From Geneva the ride is about an hour and as of 2018 a return ticket costs Fr . 58 .
#Text=Gare de Vevey .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Take bus 1 from Montreux or Chateau de Chillon to Vevey 's city centre and funicular .
#Text=By car
#Text=Vevey is next to the east-west autoroute A9 , and A12 connects the city to Berne in the northeast .
#Text=For a more scenic drive , there 's always the lakeside highway 9 from Lausanne or Montreaux .
#Text=Get around
#Text=You can walk most of the old town but for an excursion take the mountain railway to Pleiades for some great views and skiing in season .
#Text=Make sure you get the Riviera Card at your hotel , you 'll be able to use the bus for free .
#Text=You can also get a free bike for whole day with CFS 20 deposit , which just in front of " COOP " super market next to the train station .
#Text=See
#Text=Beautiful views from the lake and the lake shores .
#Text=Musee l'Histoire de Vevey ( from the main train station take the main street , turn left and go along until you 'll encounter the signs ) .
#Text=Monument de Henryk Sienkiewicz ( in the Grand Hotel du Lac ) .
#Text=The famous Nobel-prize winning writer 's monument is in the Grand Hotel 's garden , but the hotel 's personnel is happy to help and talk about it .
#Text=The writer was living and working there during his political emigration from occupied Poland .
#Text=Alimentarium , Quai Perdonnet 25 .
#Text=Tu - Su 10:00 - 17:00 , from October to March closes one hour earlier .
#Text=Food Museum ( Nestle )
#Text=Adults Fr.13 .
#Text=Villa Le Lac , Route de Lavaux 21 ( in the Corseaux district , west of downtown ) .
#Text=Designed by Le Corbusier in 1923 , this is one of 17 of his buildings to be listed as a world heritage site .
#Text=Chaplin 's World , Route de Fenil 2 , 1804 Corsier-sur-Vevey ( 3 km from city center ) , ☏ +41842422422 .
#Text=The vast estate , near Vevey , where supreme movie legend Charlie Chaplin lived with his family from 1953 to his death in 1977 .

#Text=The museum has been 15 years and an estimated 60 million francs in the making , and has two parts : the actor 's actual house , and " the Studio " , a newer building with a reconstruction of a Hollywood studio , that allows visitors to enter Chaplin 's artistic environment .
#Text=Le Nest , Chaussée de la Guinguette , ☏ +41219244040 .
#Text=Museum about Nestle 's History
#Text=Swiss Camera Museum ( Museum suisse de l’appareil photographique ) .
#Text=Museum de la Confrérie des Vignerons .
#Text=Musée Jenisch , avenue de la Gare .
#Text=Swiss museum of games ( Musée suisse du jeu ) , Au Château , ☏ +41219772300 .
#Text=Roman Catholic Church of Notre-Dame .
#Text=Orthodox Church .
#Text=Swiss Reformed Church of Saint-Martin .
#Text=Aile Castle .
#Text=Chemin de fer Blonay-Chamby , Gare de Blonay ( regular local trains run from Vevey to Blonay , on the line from Vevey to les Pleiades .
#Text=Chamby station is served by trains on the Montreux-Oberland-Bernois railway from Montreux to Zweisimmen ) .
#Text=Trains operate weekends from May to October , plus Pentecost Monday .
#Text=Switzerland 's première preserved railway and one of the most significant in Western Europe .
#Text=Both steam and vintage electric trains operate over this metre-gauge line , part of the former Chemins de fer Electriques Veveysans .
#Text=Passengers can also visit the museum and shed , which houses a large collection of metre-gauge trains and tramcars from all over Switzerland , as well as France , Germany , and Italy .
#Text=On the last Sunday of each month and on Pentecost Monday trains operate all the way from Vevey , at extra cost .
#Text=Day pass CHF20 adult , CHF10 children .
#Text=Do
#Text=Mountain Pelerin .
#Text=From the main train station take the Bus 1 , direction Vevey-Funiculaire ( ticket Fr . 2.80 ) .
#Text=Alternatively , it 's a walk of seven blocks .
#Text=The ticket for the funicular costs Fr . 10.80 ( return ) and offers nice views .
#Text=The views and atmosphere on the Mont Pelerin are marvelous , but do take the hike trip to it 's summit where the telecommunication tower is located .
#Text=It takes a bit more than an hour to get there , following an asphalt path through the rural area , yet , sometimes it is rather sloppy but nothing special .
#Text=The elevator for the tower costs Fr . 5 ( Fr . 3 for children <16yr , but recently it sells only children tickets due to a fault ) and is fully automatic .
#Text=It offers magnificent panoramic views on the Alps , Vevey and Montreux .
#Text=In the summer you can rent a pedal boat or motor boat and take a trip on the lake .
#Text=Rates vary from Fr .
#Text=18 for 1/2h on a pedal boat up to Fr . 220 for the largest motor boat for which you 'd need a boat drivers license .
#Text=Eat
#Text=National Bar .
#Text=Expect the service to be a little slow when it 's busy but if you 're not in a hurry and are out for a good time
#Text=the great atmosphere makes the wait worthwhile .
#Text=The food is great and they keep changing the menu every month .
#Text=During the summer they have a great terrace and in the winter it 's the best place to go .
#Text=It 's located just outside the border of the main square on the right side if you 're facing the lake .
#Text=Restaurant des Trois Sifflets , Rue du Simplon 1 , ☏ +41219211413 .
#Text=The cheese fondue arrives with quite the fanfare .
#Text=Restaurant Denis Martin , Rue du Château 2 , ☏ +41219211210 .
#Text=Tu - Sa from 19:00 onwards .
#Text=If you 're into molecular cuisine à la Heston Blumenthal .
#Text=From Fr . 280 .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Charlies ( just outside the main town square ) .
#Text=During the summer they open the bar right on the border of the lake , it 's the best place in town to relax and have a couple of beers until sunset .
#Text=Le V .
#Text=The Rocking Chair .
#Text=le Bout du Monde .
#Text=Drink a toast to " the end of the world " .
